item.category: Fly-tip Small - Less than one bag (Estates)

item.title: Pavement is falling apart, 20th January
item.description:
This pavement has been falling apart as long as I’ve lived here (9 years). It’s filled with cracks, holes where the asphalt has degraded and crumbled away and tiny stones which make the surface extremely uneven and dangerous (risk of slipping). I’ve seen children’s bikes and scooters slide out whilst on it and disabled pedestrians have commented on how dangerous it is. The whole pavement has dips as well. The whole piece needs to be repaired on the side of the road from number 3 to number 17. A small section of the pavement was repaired a number of years back between number one and number three., whether the repair was really poor and it has already started cracking. I think this is because cars park on the other side of the road, the outside part of the bend outside number 18, and the rubbish trucks are forced to go up and down that pavement continually week after week. In an ideal weld because that bend is a blindspot both sides should be double yellow lined so as not to restrict visibility and enable the rubbish trucks to safely pass.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmbourne Drive, Lower Belvedere, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Someone has abandoned a car in the garage of my mother's flat and shut it in, 20th January

item.title: Litter picking, 20th January
item.description:
William Foster Lane right through to next to the Car Park at Welling Stn, is absolutely in need of a major litter pick. The discarded waste rubbish of all sorts has been there for a few weeks. This is covers the pavement beyond the barriers, the grass verge and the road itself.

item.title: Remnant of wooden bollard causing trip hazard, 20th January
item.description:
This is a signed and designated pedestrian and cycling route. A wooden bollard has been removed here but has a pointy remnant left which if not seen, is likely to cause a crash This needs removal and ideally replaced with tarmac/slab

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Flat Iron Square, The Borough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
